name: Synnax
headline: Unified Hardware Control and Data Processing Software
description: We build software that helps hardware teams quickly and clearly evaluate how a component (engine, battery, valve, etc.) or process (assembly line, manufacturing plant) performs. We prevent mistakes, reduce costs, and accelerate time-to-market. Our platform unifies industrial control with sensor data storage and automated post-processing, delivering an end-to-end operations and observability stack. To put it comparatively, take LabVIEW, InfluxDB, and Grafana, wrap them into a single package, add a bit of magic, and you get Synnax.
tags: industry:hard-tech; industry:data-visualization; industry:time-series; industry:industrial; industry:databases; location:san-francisco-bay-area

founders.name: Emiliano Bonilla, Founder
founders.description: Co-Founder & CEO at Synnax. I'm classically trained in Aerospace Engineering and have a passion for building and selling great software to improve the way teams develop hardware. I led a team in the development of data processing tools for the first launches of Firefly Aerospace's Alpha rocket, one of the few new-space companies to repeatedly reach orbit. I've also worked on automous electric vehicle prototypes and developed banking software for European startups.

founders.name: Patrick Dotson, Founder
founders.description: Co-Founder & COO at Synnax. I worked on propulsion systems for the Starship program at SpaceX and have experience in both hardware and software engineering. I graduated from the University of Michigan with a degree in aerospace engineering.

founders.name: Elham Islam, Founder
founders.description: Co-Founder & CTO at Synnax. I wrote flight software for the Mars Sample Return Lander at NASA JPL and developed embedded control systems for laser communication at MIT Lincoln Laboratory. I studied computer engineering at the University of Michigan.

#  THE DATA AND OPERATIONS FOUNDATION FOR HARDWARE 
####  Synnax is the sensor database and operations framework for next generation hardware teams.  Communicate in real-time with thousands of sensors and actuators. Analyze terabytes of telemetry. Automate control and analysis workflows.
#### [ Get Started ](https://www.synnaxlabs.com/<https:/docs.synnaxlabs.com>) #### [ Request a Demo ](https://www.synnaxlabs.com/</contact>)
#####  Core 
##  The only time-series database built specifically for hardware.  Synnax is designed from the ground up to deliver performant, reliable sensor data acquisition and actuator control. 
### 8M
samples/s
Write Throughput
### 12M
samples/s
Read Throughput
### 3M
samples/s
Stream Throughput
####  Unparalleled performance.  Operate under demanding conditions with single-node read and write speeds exceeding 10 million samples per second. 
Sensors
Actuators
Visualization
Analysis
Control
####  Real-time ready.  Low latency data streaming means you can visualize sensor telemetry, control actuators, and perform analysis continuously. 
####  Scale.  Use on a bench-top with fifty channels or scale to a dispersed team with dozens of data acquisition devices and thousands of channels.

Automated

####  Seamless control handoff.  Synnax's powerful control negotation system seamlessly transitions actuator authority between automated and manual operation.
```

synnax start -l my.deployment:80 -vmi
09:16:06.838 INFO starting Synnax node  {"version": "fee9d818"}
09:16:06.890 INFO storage - opening storage {"dirname": "/synnax-data" }
09:16:06.891 INFO storage.ts - opening time series engine {"dirname": "cesium"}
09:16:06.891 INFO cluster - starting up {"storage.engine": "pebble", "storage_key": "aspen.cluster", "storage_flush_interval": "1s"}
09:16:06.978 INFO server - starting up {"insecure": true, "listen_address": "127.0.0.1:9090", "branches": ["http", "grpc", "http-redirect"], "debug": true}

```

####  Simple to deploy. Packaged as a single binary, Synnax is operational with one command. Deploy in the cloud, on-prem, or at the edge. 
#####  Drivers 
##  Integrate your existing hardware. Our drivers detect and connect to your data acquisition & control devices. 
WAGO_Logo
#####  Console 
##  A unified interface for hardware operations. Visualize real-time and historical data, configure instrumentation, and run operations from a single console. 
![](https://www.synnaxlabs.com/_astro/visualize-dark.CFRjjMTB.png) ![](https://www.synnaxlabs.com/_astro/visualize-light.CrJ_1pj-.png)
####  The fastest plotting available.  Our GPU accelerated visualization engine allows you to plot millions of points in real-time. 
![](https://www.synnaxlabs.com/_astro/organize-dark.CcXdnmLe.png) ![](https://www.synnaxlabs.com/_astro/organize-light.BVDPPbC0.png)
####  Organize resources. Categorize data sets, instrument devices, manage roles, and more.
![](https://www.synnaxlabs.com/_astro/search-dark.BH_-8J72.png) ![](https://www.synnaxlabs.com/_astro/search-light.C2aK-Lwv.png)
####  Every data set at your fingertips.  Use the search and command palette to instantly find any data set, sensor, or meta data. 
![](https://www.synnaxlabs.com/_astro/operate-light.Bpfziquh.png) ![](https://www.synnaxlabs.com/_astro/operate-dark.C3lwi_OX.png)
####  Run operations. Configure and control actuators, monitor system state, and perform analysis in real-time with our diagram assembler. 
#####  Analysis 
##  All of your data immediately available for analysis.  Post process telemetry as it's acquired, query and compare across operations. 
```
import synnax as sy
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
client = sy.Synnax()
motor_qual = sy.ranges.retrieve("EM322 Qualification")
plt.plot(
 sy.elapsed_seconds(motor_qual.time), 
 motor_qual.current_draw,
)

```

motor_qual_analysis.ipynb
image/svg+xml Artboard 61 copy
####  Explore with ease.  Access any data set in less than five lines of code, and perform analysis using industry standard tools. 
```
import numpy as np
turbo_test.meta_data["test_operator"] = "Sadie Aletha"
turbo_test.meta_data["part_no"] = "CB9612-118C"
peak_head_pressure = np.max(turbo_test.feedline_pressure)
turbo_test.meta_data["peak_head_pressure"] = peak_head_pressure

```

feedline_meta.py

####  Hook into operational events or data conditions to trigger analysis, start autosequences, send notifications, and more.

Update wiring list
Change ERP Status
#####  Open 
##  Modular. Extensible.  No proprietary programming languages. High quality client libraries. Higher quality documentation. 
###  Build custom user interfaces. Create operational consoles, custom visualizations, and more with our React component library.
React Logo
###  Develop drivers, data applications, and AI enhancements. Build software tailor-made to your use case with our C++, Python, and Typescript libraries. 
Synnax © 2024 Synnax Labs Inc.

generated_description:
### Synnax

**Founded:** 2024  
**Location:** San Francisco  
**Team Size:** 3 Employees  
**Y Combinator Batch:** S24  
**Group Partner:** Brad Flora  

#### Mission: 
Synnax is dedicated to creating a unified hardware control and data processing software. Their goal is straightforward yet ambitious: help hardware teams optimize their operations to avoid mistakes, cut costs, and speed up product launches.

#### What They Do:
Initially, Synnax focused on providing software that enables hardware teams to assess the performance of components (like engines and batteries) and processes (like production lines) efficiently. Think of Synnax as the cohesive package of tools reminiscent of LabVIEW, InfluxDB, and Grafana, but with added enhancements to support industrial operations.

Their platform serves as a comprehensive solution that integrates industrial control with sensor data storage and automated post-processing—essentially an end-to-end observability stack. It allows teams to communicate in real-time with thousands of sensors, analyze terabytes of telemetry data, and automate both control and analysis workflows.

#### Key Features:
- **Time-Series Database:** Specifically engineered for hardware setups, Synnax delivers robust sensor data acquisition and actuator control with impressive real-time performance metrics like 12 million samples per second read throughput.
  
- **Real-Time Analytics:** With low-latency data streaming, users can visualize telemetry from sensors, manage actuators, and conduct ongoing analyses seamlessly.

- **Scalability:** Synnax is versatile enough to support both small bench-top setups with limited channels and expansive operations involving multiple teams and devices.

- **Easy Deployment:** The software can be operational with a single command, and can be deployed in a variety of environments—cloud, on-premises, or at the edge.

- **Unified Interface:** A single console allows users to visualize data, manage operations, and configure instruments all in one place, enhancing efficiency and usability.

- **Open and Extensible:** Synnax promotes customization. Using their high-quality client libraries, developers can craft tailored user interfaces, create operational consoles, and integrate AI enhancements without being tied to proprietary programming languages.

#### Tags:
- Hard-tech
- Data Visualization
- Time-Series
- Industrial Solutions
- Databases
- San Francisco Bay Area

If you’re intrigued by hardware optimization and unification of control processes in tech, Synnax is in a promising space that blends industrial technology with intelligent data handling.

To learn more or get started, visit their [website](https://www.synnaxlabs.com/).
